intro: Holocheila, commonly known as the white or yellow lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Liliaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers that can be white, yellow, or pink in color. Holocheila species typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, clustered flowers on upright stems. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in woodland or meadow habitats. The genus includes several species that are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
